item.title: Scottish election 2021: SNP hopes of majority remain on a knife edge
item.description: The party gains a seat from Labour and two from the Conservatives but misses out on other key targets.

item.title: Welsh election results 2021: Labour set to stay in power
item.description: The party has matched its best ever Senedd result, winning exactly half of the 60 seats.

item.title: Elections results 2021: Conservatives make gains on English councils
item.description: Labour loses seats to Boris Johnson's party, but leader Sir Keir Starmer promises a fightback.

item.title: Al-Aqsa mosque: Dozens hurt in Jerusalem clashes
item.description: At least 163 Palestinians and six Israeli police are injured in protests over evictions in Jerusalem.

item.title: Philippines Covid surge throws country into disarray
item.description: A second Covid surge is putting renewed pressure on the country's healthcare and economy.

item.title: Covid: Travel firms reject 'overly cautious' green list
item.description: The UK will be 'left behind' if other countries open up travel more quickly, the industry says.

item.title: Brazil violence: Rio police accused by residents of abuses in raid
item.description: Residents of a Rio de Janeiro slum accuse police of violence and abuses in a raid that left 25 dead.

item.title: Sinopharm: Chinese Covid vaccine gets WHO emergency approval
item.description: It says the Sinopharm vaccine, which has been given to millions of people, is safe and effective.

item.title: Stormy Daniels: US election officials drop Trump hush money probe
item.description: The former president faced investigation over a payment made to adult film star Stormy Daniels.

item.title: Scottish election 2021: Liberal Party member suspended over Yousaf confrontation
item.description: The man had been questioning SNP MSP Humza Yousaf about events in Pakistan at a count.

item.title: Michelle Obama: Black parents have 'fear in our hearts'
item.description: The former US first lady says she is worried her daughters could be racially profiled.

item.title: The Papers: 'Labour in turmoil' as PM 'eyes decade in power'
item.description: Saturday's papers are dominated by the election results, with the Conservatives making significant gains.

item.title: 'Our first day of freedom on American soil'
item.description: Adrian Meza and his family from Nicaragua have just been released from detention by US border officials.

item.title: #MeToo Serbia: 'I thought I was the only one'
item.description: Balkan women are sharing their sexual assault stories after Serbian actress Milena Radulovic went public with hers.

item.title: 'My model railway is my little dream world'
item.description: A painstaking recreation of a lost railway line has delighted fans on social media.

item.title: India's Covid crisis: Rural hospitals unable to cope as virus spreads
item.description: We uncover the conditions that patients face in health centres unequipped for a crisis like Covid.

item.title: Covid: St Albans cathedral's new carving features facemask
item.description: The restoration of a shrine takes more than a year, having been interrupted by the pandemic.

item.title: 'They have guns but we have people': Inside Myanmar's Spring Revolution
item.description: A musician and his sister in Yangon have been filming for the BBC in Myanmar in the aftermath of a coup.

item.title: Turner Prize honours art collectives who 'inspire change'
item.description: After a year of closed galleries, the 2021 nominees are all groups who have all "inspired change".

item.title: The misinformation bubble threatening Brazil's indigenous people
item.description: Health workers report resistance because of fake content spread over WhatsApp.

item.title: Spy row revs up Czech-Russian tensions
item.description: The Czechs and Russians, ex-communist bloc allies, are in a new diplomatic Cold War.

item.title: India's Covid crisis delivers a blow to brand Modi
item.description: Narendra Modi's carefully crafted image has taken a hit as India reels from a punishing Covid wave.

item.title: Harry Redknapp in EastEnders, and five other surprise celebrity TV cameos
item.description: The ex-football manager is EastEnders' shock loan signing. Here are five other TV celebrity cameos.

item.title: Disability and domestic abuse: 'No-one knows what is happening behind those walls'
item.description: As cases of domestic abuse rise during lockdown, disabled victims can face particular challenges to escape their abusers.

item.title: Covid: The vaccine patent row explained
item.description: The US says it supports a temporary lift on vaccine patents, but some countries have pushed back.

item.title: Leicester City 2-4 Newcastle United: Callum Wilson double in Magpies win
item.description: Newcastle move to within one point of Premier League safety with an impressive win over Champions League-chasing Leicester City.

item.title: Premier League 'big six' among nine clubs to accept Uefa sanctions for ESL involvement
item.description: Nine of the original European Super League clubs are fined by Uefa over last month's proposed breakaway.

item.title: Murray to practise with Djokovic and hopes to be fit for French Open
item.description: Andy Murray will practise with Novak Djokovic in Rome on Sunday and hopes to return to action in 10 days' time.

item.title: Fans should not travel to Turkey for Champions League final, says UK government
item.description: Chelsea and Manchester City fans should not travel to Turkey for the Champions League, the UK government has said.

item.title: Watch: Billy Joe Saunders and Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez face-off at weigh-in
item.description: Billy Joe Saunders and Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez face-off at the weigh-in before their WBC, WBA and WBO world super-middleweight fight in Texas.

item.title: A hat snatch and battle of words - Mayweather & Paul go head to head
item.description: Jake Paul snatches Floyd Mayweather's cap and the former world champion says he would take on both brothers during a heated event to promote his fight with Logan Paul on 6 June in Miami.

item.title: 2021 elections: What are the results in my area?
item.description: National elections in Scotland and Wales and local elections in England took place on 6 May 2021.

item.title: Elections 2021: Labour insiders on Starmer, what went wrong and how to fix it
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer took charge of Labour a year ago and has faced his first challenge at the polls.

item.title: Election 2021: When will we find out the results?
item.description: Millions of people have marked their ballots, but there could be a long wait this year.

item.title: Scottish election results 2021: The story so far
item.description: The key results and moments from the first day of counting in the Holyrood election.

item.title: Welsh election results 2021: Key charts so far
item.description: A summary of the Welsh election story so far.

item.title: Elections 2021: How to follow the results on the BBC
item.description: Find out how to keep up to date with live election results on TV, radio, online and on social media.

item.title: What to expect in Scottish election
item.description: Scots have cast their votes, but they will not be counted until Friday and Saturday - when will the outcome be known?

item.title: Which countries are on the green list for foreign holidays?
item.description: A new "traffic light" system for travel classifies countries as green, amber or red.

item.title: What is a Covid passport and what are the plans for the NHS app?
item.description: The government is considering how people could prove they are unlikely to transmit Covid.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules and the rule of six?
item.description: Rules on hugging and social distancing in England are being reviewed.

item.title: Covid: Should I be working from home or going back to the office?
item.description: As lockdown restrictions ease gradually across the UK, what are the rules about returning to work?

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as more than 35 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: What refund rights are there for holidays abroad?
item.description: Quarantine-free overseas holidays will be possible after 17 May, but what rights do you have if plans or rules change?

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

item.title: How many cases in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: Northern Ireland is the latest part of the UK to lift some of the restrictions designed to stop the spread of Covid-19.
